title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 220-3.4 - Emissions from Asphalt Cement Storage Tanks
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 220-3.4 - Emissions from Asphalt Cement Storage Tanks

State Regulations
(a) Asphalt Mixture Processing Units, with a
calculated annual production level equal to or greater than 75,000 tons per
year of asphalt mixture, must comply with the following: (1)

Within one year of the effective date of
this Subpart the owner or operator shall install equipment that is designed to
capture and control emissions of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) associated
with the heating of asphalt cement storage tanks. Each asphalt cement storage
tank shall vent through a tank vent condenser or similar suitable control
device. Multiple tanks may vent through the same control device if the venting
equipment is p roperly sized and rated to adequately handle the quantity of
VOCs emitted from the tanks. Once installed, these control devices must remain
in place and continue to operate, regardless of future calculated annual
production levels. (2)

The filling
of asphalt cement storage tanks should be observed to prevent or mitigate
potential spills by the delivery company and/or asphalt mixture manufacturing
plant personnel. Notes
